Tucson remains still with a light hearted grin on his muzzle.

" Of course =
my friend, I was just toying with them, nothing serious.  Now, a lot of my =
skills in combat revolve around balance, poise, focus and most important, i=
nner peace.  Such was the teachings of Master Yokitron.  Which I really sho=
uld be continuing.  Mach Kick, you can stay on my back, just be sure to hol=
d onto me securely.   I'm going to warm up with some basic exercises in bal=
ance.  And I think I would like to continue in beast mode. "

He slowly get=
s up on his hind legs, standing in a near erect position.  Instead of curli=
ng his front legs into his chest, he stretches them out and begins his exer=
cises.   A look of serenity comes over his face as his front legs work as a=
rms and hands, in a graceful dance of poise and tranquility.  Slowly, his h=
ind legs and feet begin to move gracefully in unison with his upper body.  =
As his tail moves with his body, a gentile breeze is kicked up in it's wake=
. He minds his feet and moves carefully around his new friends.  It was his=
 way of training for battle.  The more he moves the faster his arms and leg=
s move as swift taloned hands perform the same functions as they were if he=
 were in robot mode.  And then the dance blossoms into an impressive displa=
y of martial arts as the Silver Dragon performs a stellar spin/ revolving k=
ick maneuver.  He lands on his feet without a wobble in his legs or ankles.=
  He turns his head to see if Mach Kick was still on his back.

" The reaso=
n why I chose to warm up this way is because typically, no one expects a tr=
ansformer to fight that way in alt form.  When I first met Master Yokitron,=
 he asked me to do something completely out of the normal routine of combat=
 training.  I was an Autobot back then and he asked me to remain in vehicle=
 form during the first lesson.  I thought he was kidding but he wasn't. So =
then he asked me to drive a little down a road that he sanctioned for Autob=
ot training.  I went down that road and suddenly, I found myself on two whe=
els instead of four.  I was an SUV at the time and I was shocked clear out =
of my suspension cables when I went up on my left front and rear tires.   T=
here was a ramp under me and I did not expect it.  But then he said that ev=
en a bulky vehicle can find balance.  And if a bulky vehicle can find balan=
ce, so can a dragon.  This is what I'm going to try and convey in the battl=
e field."

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Oct 6, 2011, a=
t 12:27 PM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
=
> > Tucson swings around and stares at the trio with a wise gaze.
> >
> > "=
 It's about building strength and endurance. The more weight I'm able to
> =
> carry, the stronger my systems become and the more I can endure in the ri=
ng.
> > "
> > With a swipe of his tail, Tucson hits the inside wall with th=
e sharp spikes,
> > attempting to give a demonstration of his tail strength=
. The swipe is fast
> > and hard. He grins calmly at the guards.
> 
> TUSCO=
N's tail hit the wall with a loud thud and left the slightest
> scratch, mo=
re of a chipping of paint then a true mark.
> 
> The gaurds laughted, "That=
 cell is created from Duranium, you'll not
> get through that!"
> 
> Shakin=
g their headds they started to walk on.
> 
> "Be still Tuscon." BIG CONVOYS=
 said in low yet kindly tones. "We may
> seem like we're doing nothing but =
have not been idle. We have just had
> to move slowly and carefully."
> 
> =
MACHKICK, still sitting on TUSCON's back just stuck a tongue out at
> the d=
eparting guard's backs.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-26-321670660

TUSCON's tail hit the wall with a loud thud and left the slightest<br>

atch, more of a chipping of paint then a true mark.<br>

l Tuscon." BIG CONVOYS said in low yet kindly tones. "We may<br>
seem like =

owly and carefully."<br>

 stuck a tongue out at<br>
